label.name: poolingProfileLabel
label.caption: Define connection pool configuration

integer.name: maxActive
integer.caption: Max active
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can be borrowed from the pool at one time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be active at one time. When maxActive is exceeded, the pool is said to be exhausted.

integer.name: maxIdle
integer.caption: Max idle
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can sit idle in the pool at any time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be idle at one time.

enum.name: initialisationPolicy
enum.caption: Initialisation policy
enum.description: Determines how connections in a pool should be initialized. The possible values are: INITIALISE_NONE (will not load any connection into the pool on startup), INITIALISE_ONE (will load one initial connection into the pool on startup), or INITIALISE_ALL (will load all connections in the pool on startup)

enum.name: exhaustedAction
enum.caption: Exhausted action
enum.description: Specifies the behavior of the connection pool when the pool is exhausted. Possible values are: "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_FAIL", which will throw a NoSuchElementException, "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT", which will block by invoking Object.wait(long) until a new or idle object is available, or WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW, which will create a new connection and return it, essentially making maxActive meaningless. If a positive maxWait value is supplied, it will block for at most that many milliseconds, after which a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. If maxThreadWait is a negative value, it will block indefinitely.

integer.name: maxWait
integer.caption: Max wait
integer.description: When exhausted action is Wait (or block) this is the amount of time in milliseconds that the pool will wait before failing. Setting a negative value will block indefinitely until an idle instance becomes available.

integer.name: minEvictionMillis
integer.caption: Min eviction (ms)
integer.description: Determines the minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. When non-positive, no connections will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

integer.name: evictionCheckIntervalMillis
integer.caption: Eviction check interval (ms)
integer.description: Specifies the number of milliseconds between runs of the connection evictor. When non-positive, no connection evictor is executed.

label.name: connectionLabel
label.caption: Define how mule should attempt to handle a connection failure

radioBoolean.name: noReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Do not use a Reconnection strategy

radioBoolean.name: standardReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Standard Reconnection
radioBoolean.description: A reconnection strategy that allows the user to configure how many times a reconnection should be attempted and how long to wait between attempts.

integer.name: reconnectionAttemps
integer.caption: Reconnection Attempts
integer.description: How many reconnection attempts to make

boolean.name: reconnectForever
boolean.caption: Reconnect Forever
boolean.description: A reconnection strategy that retries an infinite number of times at the specified frequency.

classname.name: class
classname.caption: Class
classname.description: A class that implements the RetryPolicyTemplate interface.

name.name: name
name.caption: Name
name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.

string.name: apiKey
string.caption: Api Key
string.description: The "API key (secret)" provided in the "Application Info".

string.name: appName
string.caption: App Name
string.description: The name of your application. In "Application Domain" -> https://[appName].rpxnow.com/.

string.name: appId
string.caption: App Id
string.description: The "App ID" provided in the "Application Info".

string.name: captureHost
string.caption: Capture Host
string.description: The host that you will using for your capture API. It might be the same as "Application Domain" or you can personalize this one.

globalRef.name: config-ref
globalRef.caption: Config Reference
globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.

cloud-connector.caption: Janrain
cloud-connector.description: Janrain Cloud Connector for API V2.

string.name: activity
string.caption: Activity
string.description: The activity structure, JSON-encoded.

string.name: deviceToken
string.caption: Device Token
string.description: The identifier URL or device_token of the user sharing an activity. Do not use the device_token with mobile browsers.

string.name: identifier
string.caption: Identifier
string.description: The identifier URL or device_token of the user sharing an activity. Do not use the device_token with mobile browsers.

string.name: source
string.caption: Source
string.description: Must be domain or URL. Defines a specific domain or URL as the source page of the sharing activity. Used by analytics to categorize posts by domain.

string.name: urlShortening
string.caption: Url Shortening
string.description: A boolean indicating whether to provide the entire URL in the post or tweet, or the shortened version. (PRO).

boolean.name: prependName
boolean.caption: Prepend Name
boolean.description: If true, prepend the user’s name to the action when posting to Facebook (ignored for other providers).

boolean.name: truncate
boolean.caption: Truncate
boolean.description: If true, truncate the activity update text when posting to providers which impose length restrictions (currently Twitter).

string.caption: Device Token
string.description: The identifier URL or deviceToken of the user sharing an activity. Do not use the deviceToken with mobile browsers.

string.caption: Identifier
string.description: The identifier URL or deviceToken of the user sharing an activity. Do not use the deviceToken with mobile browsers.

string.name: image
string.caption: Image
string.description: An image associated with the content being shared.

string.name: media
string.caption: Media
string.description: The Flash or video object associated with the content being shared.

string.name: message
string.caption: Message
string.description: Message associated with the activity being shared.

string.name: recipientUrls
string.caption: Recipient Urls
string.description: Allows for sharing multiple urls to multiple recipients. The value is a JSON object of recipients and shared urls.

string.name: recipients
string.caption: Recipients
string.description: A list of identifiers in JSON associated with the recipients being contacted.

string.name: source
string.caption: Source
string.description: URL of the site sharing the activity.

string.name: title
string.caption: Title
string.description: The title given to the shared content.

string.name: url
string.caption: Url
string.description: The URL associated to the content being shared.

string.description: The "API key (secret)" provided in the "Application Info".

string.name: appName
string.caption: App Name
string.description: The name of your application. In "Application Domain" -> https://[appName].rpxnow.com/.

string.name: appId
string.caption: App Id
string.description: The "App ID" provided in the "Application Info".

string.name: captureHost
string.caption: Capture Host
string.description: The host that you will using for your capture API. It might be the same as "Application Domain" or you can personalize this one.

string.name: access_token
string.caption: Access_token
string.description: Required when authenticating with an OAuth access_token.

string.name: attribute_name
string.caption: Attribute_name
string.description: This is a schema path to an individual attribute.

string.name: attributes
string.caption: Attributes
string.description: This is a JSON array of attributes.

string.name: client_id
string.caption: Client_id
string.description: Required when authenticating with client settings.

string.name: client_secret
string.caption: Client_secret
string.description: Required when authenticating with client settings.

string.name: created
string.caption: Created
string.description: Timestamps are generated when an entity is created.

string.name: id
string.caption: Id
string.description: Required when not using key_attribute or uuid parameters.

string.name: key_attribute
string.caption: Key_attribute
string.description: Required when not using id or uuid.

string.name: key_value
string.caption: Key_value
string.description: Required when using key_attribute.

string.name: last_updated
string.caption: Last_updated
string.description: Timestamps are generated when an entity is updated.

string.name: password_attribute
string.caption: Password_attribute
string.description: Entity can be used to validate user passwords.

string.name: password_value
string.caption: Password_value
string.description: A plaintext value that will be matched against the password attribute specified in the password_attribute parameter.

string.name: type_name
string.caption: Type_name
string.description: The entityType of the entity.

string.name: uuid
string.caption: Uuid
string.description: Required when not using id or key_attribute paramaters.

string.caption: Password

string.caption: Server

string.caption: Username

string.caption: Version
string.description: The Backplane server version, for example, v1.1. The default value is v1.

boolean.name: remove
boolean.caption: Remove
boolean.description: False is the default. If false, add a new Backplane configuration; otherwise, remove the Backplane configuration for the specified server or bus.

string.caption: Api Key

string.name: appName
string.caption: App Name
string.description: The name of your application. In "Application Domain" -> https://[appName].rpxnow.com/.

string.name: appId
string.caption: App Id
string.description: The "App ID" provided in the "Application Info".

string.name: captureHost
string.caption: Capture Host
string.description: The host that you will using for your capture API. It might be the same as "Application Domain" or you can personalize this one.

string.name: consumerKey
string.caption: Consumer Key
string.description: This is the Consumer Key for the user’s application.

string.name: email
string.caption: Email
string.description: PayPal only: enter a valid email address that is already registered with a PayPal account.

string.name: engageApiKey
string.caption: Engage Api Key
string.description: The Engage API Key of the application to configure.

string.name: fbAppID
string.caption: Fb App I D
string.description: Facebook only: The Application Id for the user’s Facebook application.

string.name: fbSecret
string.caption: Fb Secret
string.description: Facebook Only: The Application Secret for the user’s Facebook application.

string.name: liveidAppID
string.caption: Liveid App I D
string.description: Windows Live only: The Application ID for the user’s Windows Live application.

string.name: liveidPrivacyPolicyUrl
string.caption: Liveid Privacy Policy Url
string.description: Windows Live only: The URL for the Windows Live application’s privacy policy.

string.name: liveidSecret
string.caption: Liveid Secret
string.description: Windows Live only: The Secret Key for the user’s Windows Live application.

string.name: partnerKey
string.caption: Partner Key
string.description: Your Engage partner key, which you can find on the dashboard.

string.name: paypalDisplayName
string.caption: Paypal Display Name
string.description: PayPal only: The display name for the user’s Paypal application.

string.name: provider
string.caption: Provider
string.description: The name of the provider to configure.

string.name: secret
string.caption: Secret
string.description: The consumer secret the user’s application.

string.name: uninstallURL
string.caption: Uninstall U R L
string.description: Facebook only: This is the URL that is invoked when the user uninstalls the Facebook application.

string.name: yahooAppID
string.caption: Yahoo App I D
string.description: Yahoo only: The Application ID for the user’s Yahoo application.

boolean.name: activityScopesSet
boolean.caption: Activity Scopes Set
boolean.description: Yahoo only: Set to true if the user’s Yahoo application has read and write permissions for “Status” and “Updates.”.

boolean.name: contactsScopeSet
boolean.caption: Contacts Scope Set
boolean.description: Yahoo only: Set to true if the user’s Yahoo application has read permission for “Contacts.”.

boolean.name: emailPerm
boolean.caption: Email Perm
boolean.description: Facebook only: Set to true if this application needs email to receive end-user email addresses.

string.description: This is the uuid of the webhook.

label.caption: Use these fields to override the credentials defined in the Janrain connector.

string.name: apiKey
string.caption: Api Key
string.description: The "API key (secret)" provided in the "Application Info".

string.name: appName
string.caption: App Name
string.description: The name of your application. In "Application Domain" -> https://[appName].rpxnow.com/.

string.name: appId
string.caption: App Id
string.description: The "App ID" provided in the "Application Info".

string.name: captureHost
string.caption: Capture Host
string.description: The host that you will using for your capture API. It might be the same as "Application Domain" or you can personalize this one.

string.name: client_id
string.caption: Client_id
string.description: The client identifier of the target Capture application, available in the dashboard.

string.name: client_secret
string.caption: Client_secret
string.description: The shared secret paired with the client_id.

string.name: attributes
string.caption: Attributes
string.description: This is applicable only when event_type is update.

string.name: callback
string.caption: Callback
string.description: The URL address where the webhook message is to be delivered and processed.

string.name: client_secret
string.caption: Client_secret
string.description: The shared secret paired with the client_id.

string.name: entity_type
string.caption: Entity_type
string.description: The schema where the attribute is defined. Most of the time, this will be the default schema user.

string.name: event_type
string.caption: Event_type
string.description: The type of change that triggers the webhook.
